messages.title: A prescription for a stronger NHS
messages.content: With a majority government that can get Brexit done, we can take back control of our borders. That means we can introduce an Australian-style points-based immigration system. Taking pressure off our public services.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: 300 new MRI machines, CT scanners and breast-screening machines; 50,000 more nurses; 40 new hospitals and 20 hospital upgrades; Clamp down on health tourism.
A new NHS visa for the world's best doctors and nurses; An Australian-style points-based immigration system; £33.9 billion extra for the NHS; 50 million more GP surgery appointments.

mentions.tacticalSituation: With Brexit done, we can take back control of our borders. The only way to get Brexit done and get an immigration system that supports our public services is to vote Conservative.

issues.brexitEurope: Let's get Brexit done – so we can focus on the country’s priorities.
issues.health: 300 new MRI machines, CT scanners and breast-screening machines; 50,000 more nurses; 40 new hospitals and 20 hospital upgrades; A new NHS visa for the world’s best doctors and nurses; 50 million extra GP surgery appointments; 6,000 more doctors.
issues.immigration: Clamp down on health tourism; An Australian-style points-based immigration system; An immigration system that supports our NHS; We need to protect our public services - not put pressure on them. But under a Tory government, Brexit would be up in the air and immigration would be rising.

contactInformation.address: CCHQ, 4 Matthew Parker Street, London, SW1H 9HQ

Our public services can’t afford uncontrolled immigration - but that's what Jeremy Corbyn would deliver

Our hardworking doctors and nurses can’t afford higher taxes - but Jeremy Corbyn wants to tax everyone more
